commits.subject: Fix send-interest crash: add .js extension to ESM import of lib/constants
commits.body:
The extensionless import from "../lib/constants" worked in dev/test (Vite/Vitest
handle resolution) but failed at Vercel's Node.js ESM runtime which requires
explicit .js extensions for relative imports. This caused every request to
/api/send-interest to crash before any code ran—including CORS preflight—which
the mobile frontend diagnosed as a CORS failure.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01KJvPZM9yZQvKhdk1TkDe38
commits.title: Fix send-interest crash: add .js extension to ESM import of lib/constants

commits.body: Add React frontend with Vite and Tailwind CSS

commits.subject: Set framework to vite and outputDirectory to dist in vercel.json
commits.body:
Vercel's auto-detection didn't pick up Vite — the build succeeded
but it looked for output in public/ instead of dist/. Setting both
explicitly resolves the "No Output Directory named public" error.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01UaGdKLgaAMkoTv4G1ga8sc
commits.title: Set framework to vite and outputDirectory to dist in vercel.json

commits.subject: Add Vite + React + Tailwind frontend to fix Vercel API 404s
commits.body:
Instead of more config-only fixes, give Vercel a real framework it
natively understands. Vite builds the landing page and Vercel
auto-detects api/ functions alongside it — no ambiguous build pipeline.

- Add minimal landing page with API health indicator and see-veo link
- Remove framework:null and root→api rewrite from vercel.json
- Update build script from no-op to vite build
- Update moduleResolution to bundler for Vite plugin types

https://claude.ai/code/session_01UaGdKLgaAMkoTv4G1ga8sc
commits.title: Add Vite + React + Tailwind frontend to fix Vercel API 404s

commits.subject: Fix API 404s by switching from legacy builds to zero-config Vercel
commits.body:
The legacy `builds` property in vercel.json combined with api/package.json
caused Vercel to treat the api/ directory as a single function unit (only
exposing index.ts), making /api/health and /api/send-interest return 404.

- Remove `builds` array to use Vercel's modern auto-detection pipeline
- Add `framework: null` to prevent framework auto-detection
- Delete api/package.json (redundant — root package.json already provides
  "type": "module" and nodemailer dependency)

https://claude.ai/code/session_01UaGdKLgaAMkoTv4G1ga8sc
commits.title: Fix API 404s by switching from legacy builds to zero-config Vercel

commits.body: Enable ES modules support across the project

commits.subject: Add "type": "module" to fix ES module runtime error on Vercel
commits.body:
The TypeScript config outputs ES2020 module syntax but package.json
lacked "type": "module", causing Node.js to load compiled .js files
as CommonJS and fail with "SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'".

https://claude.ai/code/session_017Chg9Fvh8hJ94SLg26umaY
commits.title: Add "type": "module" to fix ES module runtime error on Vercel

commits.body: Restructure project: move API files to root directory
commits.title: Merge pull request #9 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-missing-api-endpoints-Cmjq8

commits.subject: Add api/package.json for Vercel function-level dependency install
commits.body:
The @vercel/node builder runs npm install inside api/ for each
function. Without a package.json there, the install fails with ENOENT.
Declare nodemailer (the only runtime dep) so the builder can install it.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Add api/package.json for Vercel function-level dependency install

commits.subject: Use builds config to bypass static-site pipeline entirely
commits.body:
The zero-config pipeline assumes a static site and demands an output
directory. Previous attempts to satisfy it (buildCommand: "", mkdir,
placeholder files) kept hitting the next check. Switch to the builds
allowlist model: only api/*.ts files are built via @vercel/node, no
output directory needed. Root npm install still runs for dependencies.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Use builds config to bypass static-site pipeline entirely

commits.subject: Fix build: output directory must be non-empty
commits.body:
Vercel rejects an empty output directory. Write a placeholder file so
the static output check passes and function deployment proceeds.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Fix build: output directory must be non-empty

commits.subject: Fix build: use mkdir for output dir instead of skipping build
commits.body:
buildCommand: "" skips the entire install+build pipeline, so Vercel
tries a per-function npm install in api/ which fails (no package.json
there). Instead, let the normal pipeline run and create an empty
public/ at build time to satisfy the output directory check.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Fix build: use mkdir for output dir instead of skipping build

commits.subject: Move constants.ts out of api/ to prevent stray Vercel endpoint
commits.body:
Vercel treats every file in api/ as a serverless function. constants.ts
is a helper module (no handler), so it was being exposed as a broken
/api/constants endpoint. Move it to lib/ where Vercel won't touch it.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Move constants.ts out of api/ to prevent stray Vercel endpoint

commits.subject: Configure Vercel for API-only deployment, remove unused favicons
commits.body:
This is a pure serverless API with no frontend — favicons were never
referenced by any code. Instead of keeping dead static files to satisfy
Vercel's output directory check, configure vercel.json properly:
- "framework": null declares no frontend framework
- "buildCommand": "" skips the build step entirely, so Vercel never
  looks for an output directory

Replaces the workaround from 7fc7936 that moved favicons to public/.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Configure Vercel for API-only deployment, remove unused favicons

commits.subject: Move favicons to public/ to fix Vercel build error
commits.body:
Vercel expects a "public" output directory for non-framework projects.
The no-op build command (true) doesn't create one, causing the build
to fail with "No Output Directory named public found". Moving favicons
into public/ ensures the directory exists and static files are served.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Move favicons to public/ to fix Vercel build error

commits.subject: Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to deploy from repo root
commits.body:
Vercel's GitHub integration uses the repo root as the project root,
but all config and function files were nested inside an api/ subdirectory.
This caused vercel.json to not be found and serverless functions to map
to /api/api/* instead of /api/*, resulting in 404s on all endpoints.

Flatten the structure: move config files (vercel.json, package.json,
tsconfig.json, etc.) to repo root, move serverless functions from
api/api/ to api/, and place favicons at repo root for static serving.
Update documentation paths accordingly.

https://claude.ai/code/session_018GdxVNVycPS8x1KTytw3hi
commits.title: Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to deploy from repo root

commits.title: Add @vercel/node to devDependencies to fix build type errors

commits.subject: Merge pull request #7 from devmade-ai/claude/add-favicon-CKRS0
commits.body: Reorganize project structure and files
commits.title: Merge pull request #7 from devmade-ai/claude/add-favicon-CKRS0

commits.subject: Fix serverless function deployment by removing vercel devDep and adding build script
commits.body:
Two issues were preventing successful Vercel builds:

1. `vercel` in devDependencies caused Vercel to warn "will be
   ignored" and strip it before npm install, creating a mismatch
   with the lockfile. Removed it since the Vercel CLI is provided
   by the platform.

2. No `build` script existed — if the Vercel project has a build
   command configured (even the default `npm run build`), it would
   fail. Added a no-op build script since serverless functions
   don't need a build step (Vercel compiles TypeScript automatically).

https://claude.ai/code/session_017jorRZB6ANxXDQhyH1Xdom
commits.title: Fix serverless function deployment by removing vercel devDep and adding build script

commits.subject: Move favicons to project root for Vercel static file serving
commits.body:
Vercel only auto-serves files from public/ for framework projects
(Next.js, etc.). For plain serverless projects, static files must
be at the project root. Since the Vercel root directory is set to
api/, move favicon.ico and favicon.png from api/public/ to api/.

https://claude.ai/code/session_017jorRZB6ANxXDQhyH1Xdom
commits.title: Move favicons to project root for Vercel static file serving

commits.subject: Revert "Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to standard layout"
commits.body: This reverts commit 50cb3bde2ad34086ebf4ac41e9f84c669e4956de.
commits.title: Revert "Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to standard layout"

commits.subject: Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to standard layout
commits.body:
All routes (/, /favicon.ico, /favicon.png, /api/*) returned 404
because the Vercel project files were nested inside an api/
subdirectory. Vercel's default root directory is the repo root,
so it couldn't find vercel.json, the serverless functions, or
static assets.

Restructure to the standard Vercel layout:
- vercel.json, package.json, tsconfig.json at repo root
- api/ contains serverless function handlers
- public/ contains static assets (favicon.ico, favicon.png)

https://claude.ai/code/session_017jorRZB6ANxXDQhyH1Xdom
commits.title: Fix Vercel 404s by restructuring project to standard layout

commits.subject: Add interest notification API and frontend form
commits.body:
Set up Vercel serverless functions for an interest/contact notification
system. The send-interest endpoint validates input (name, email, message),
enforces CORS origin restrictions, includes honeypot spam protection, and
sends emails via SMTP using nodemailer. A health endpoint is included for
deployment verification. The frontend InterestForm React component handles
form state, submission, and gracefully degrades when the API URL is not
configured.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01Gw4Mev3VZzsYEcxPYsUFzA
commits.title: Add interest notification API and frontend form

commits.subject: Add interest notification API with Vercel serverless functions
commits.body:
Implements a contact form backend for CV sites: POST /api/send-interest
validates input (name, email, message) with length limits and format
checks, enforces CORS via ALLOWED_ORIGINS, includes honeypot spam
detection, escapes HTML in email body, and sends via nodemailer/SMTP.
Also adds a /api/health endpoint and project scaffolding (tsconfig,
vercel.json, .env.example).

https://claude.ai/code/session_011tsFkSugnqQ5vtsLDcKL7n
commits.title: Add interest notification API with Vercel serverless functions
